name: mannose receptor C-type 1
other_names: C-type lectin domain family 13 member D

reactome.name: Modulation by Mtb of host immune system
Class I MHC mediated antigen processing & presentation
Class I MHC mediated antigen processing & presentation

summary: The recognition of complex carbohydrate structures on glycoproteins is an important part of several biological processes, including cell-cell recognition, serum glycoprotein turnover, and neutralization of pathogens. The protein encoded by this gene is a type I membrane receptor that mediates the endocytosis of glycoproteins by macrophages. The protein has been shown to bind high-mannose structures on the surface of potentially pathogenic viruses, bacteria, and fungi so that they can be neutralized by phagocytic engulfment.[provided by RefSeq, Sep 2015].
